alert.note: Alert for Kahoolawe in Maui (Hawaii) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued October 14 at 9:50PM HST by NWS Honolulu
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 1 AM HST SATURDAY FOR THE ISLAND OF MAUI IN MAUI COUNTY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall. * WHERE...The island of Maui in Maui County. * WHEN...Until 100 AM HST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding on roads, poor drainage areas, and in streams. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 948 PM HST, radar continues to indicate heavy rain over portions of East Maui. Rain was falling at a rate of 0.5 to 1.5 inches per hour. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Kipahulu, Nahiku, Hana, Keanae, Wailua, and Hamoa. This advisory may need to be extended beyond 100 AM HST if flooding persists.
info.instruction: Stay away from streams, drainage ditches and low lying areas prone to flooding. This advisory replaces the previous advisory that was in effect for the island of Maui in Maui County
